channel.title: Herald-Tribune (Custom RSS - Broad Article Grab)
channel.description: A personal RSS feed with broader article scraping from heraldtribune.com

item.title: Get the new Millie Bobby Brown x Crocs Unfurgettable Clog for fall
item.description: Crocs knows how to nail a good collab. FromKrispy Kremeto "The Summer I Turned Pretty," the iconic footwear brand has been teaming up with some heavy hitters this summer. Oh, and Millie Bobby Brown just entered chat.

item.title: Get ready for the U.S. Open by saving 30% on Nike tennis shoes
item.description: Tennis' besthead to NYC for the U.S. Open, the final major of the season.

item.title: Mega Millions winning numbers for Aug. 15: $198 million jackpot
item.description: TheMega Millionsjackpot rose to $198 million for the drawing on Friday, Aug. 15, after no one matched all the winning numbers in the drawing on Tuesday, Aug. 12.

item.title: NFL Sunday Ticket 2025: Price breakdown, discounts, what to know
item.description: The kickoff ofthe NFL regular seasonis rapidly approaching and if you are a football junkie or a fan of an out-of-town team, you will want to get connected withNFL Sunday Ticket.

item.title: Erin expected to strengthen into Category 4 hurricane with 140-mph winds
item.description: In a rush? Get an abbreviated, text view of what's happening withHurricane Erin.

item.title: Here's a quick look on what you should know about Hurricane Erin
item.description: Tight on time? This story is for you. It's an abbreviated, text view of what's happening withTropical Storm Erin.Click here for more detailsand to see thelatest spaghetti models.

item.title: Haters won't admit Trump's success and popularity
item.description: The truth is thatPresident Donald Trumpis making life for ALL Americans better.

item.title: Greater Sarasota Chamber of Commerce hosts annual Leadership Awards
item.description: TheGreater Sarasota Chamber of Commercewill host the annual Celebrate Outstanding Leadership Awards on Aug. 13 from 11:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. at Michael’s On East in Sarasota.

item.title: The Big Beautiful Bill and its big opportunity for wealthy families
item.description: If you’ve ever felt like everything shifted overnight – tax laws, investment dynamics, retirement realities – you’re not imagining it. The Big Beautiful Bill, signed July 3, may seem like political theater, but for affluent families, it quietly reshapes how wealth is saved, transferred, and preserved.

item.title: See the winners of the Herald-Tribune's 2025 Sarasota-Manatee Top Workplaces
item.description: How do you judge the quality of a workplace? Ask the experts: The employees.

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk. Here's why I decided to sell the house
item.description: I should know by now, if you venture into an exploratory hypothetical conversation with a real estate broker, you might as well start packing. One casual conversation with a broker friend started the house hurricane.

item.title: Walking the rightsizing walk, part 2: How I stopped hyperventilating
item.description: Now that my husband, DC, and I had sold the Happier Yellow House to the first buyer who saw it, we were quite suddenly, technically, homeless. Yeep! My head was literally spinning. I need to sit down often and put my head between my knees.

item.title: 11,000 gallons of sewage spill into Hatchett Creek in Venice
item.description: VENICE – About 11,000 gallons of untreated wastewater spilled in Hatchett Creek early Friday near the intersection of East Venice and Warfield avenues after failure of a contractor’s pumping equipment as part of a city sewer pipeline project.

item.title: New College of Florida attracts top educatorsDavid Rohrbacher Guest columnist
item.description: If you want to see the future of higher education, don’t look to theIvy League. Look to the shores of Sarasota Bay.

item.title: Sarasota’s performing arts center trails other major local projects
item.description: Seven years ago, Sarasota unveiled an ambitious plan for its bayfront — a reimagined 53-acre waterfront park crowned by a state-of-the-art performing arts center to replace the agingVan Wezel, funded equally by private donations and public dollars.
